Stable White-Collar Hiring:The Naukri JobSpeak Index remained stable at 2,807 in May 2025, mirroring the levels seen in May 2024.

Booming AI/ML Sector:Hiring for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) roles experienced a 25% year-on-year (YoY) increase, driven by demand across metro cities like Delhi NCR (+35%), Chennai (+34%), and Kolkata (+33%). This growth was observed across all experience levels, including a 36% rise for professionals with 13-16 years of experience and a 22% increase in fresher hiring within the AI/ML sector.

Increased Demand for Senior Professionals:Hiring for professionals with over 16 years of experience increased by 6% YoY, a trend that has been consistent throughout the past year. This was particularly evident in the Oil & Gas (+21%) and Real Estate (+17%) sectors.

Growth in Non-IT Sectors for Freshers:Despite overall flat fresher hiring, non-IT industries showed positive momentum for entry-level roles. The Insurance sector led with a 26% increase, followed by Real Estate (+12%), BPO/ITES (+5%), and Hospitality (+4%).

Unicorn Companies Driving Hiring:Unicorn companies demonstrated strong hiring momentum with a 25% increase, especially in Banking and Financial Services (+35%), Internet/E-commerce (+18%), and IT (+16%).

Positive Hiring Trends in Certain Cities:Hyderabad and Kochi saw 7% and 8% growth respectively, largely driven by hiring for senior-level professionals (16+ years of experience). Pune also witnessed a 4% increase in hiring, boosted by a significant 26% rise in startup hiring.

Challenges in the IT Sector:The IT sector, in contrast, experienced a 5% decline in hiring in May 2025.

Info Edge (India) Limited, the parent company of Naukri, released its Naukri JobSpeak Report for May 2025, which highlighted several key hiring trends .

Here's a summary of the findings:

Dr. Pawan Goyal, Executive Director & Chief Business Officer at Naukri, commented on these trends, noting the stability of the job market and the notable growth in AI/ML hiring and demand for senior professionals. He also highlighted the positive sign of increased fresher hiring in non-tech industries.

Additionally, Info Edge (India) Ltd announced a 1:5 stock split with a record date of May 7, 2025, to improve liquidity and attract more retail investors. This means each ₹10 share will be divided into five shares of ₹2 each, according to The Economic Times .
